channel.title: Bought A Domain
channel.description: I just purchased a domain from GoDaddy, I don't know what to do now, I already have I website programmed and ready for upload.

item.title: Bought A Domain
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Mikeyzzz, post:23, topic:475346”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=593447.msg4193205#msg4193205 date=1357124498]

[quote author=Mikeyzzz link=topic=593447.msg4193201#msg4193201 date=1357123734]

I’m sure people know this is a template, I told people in the dev thread.

Lolol, don’t i remember you from somewhere? i think i was helping you or something. Your msn name is Mikeyy.
[/quote]I haven’t been on MSN in years

I don’t think its “Years”, i think it’s “months”.
[/quote]nope literally like 1 year and a bit.[/quote]
So, like he said, it isn’t “years”…

Also, this is a prime example of why you should learn what you need to do to benefit from your spend before you actually spend.

Read full topic

item.title: Bought A Domain
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Depends what you bought from GoDaddy, it could have been a web host and domain package, however, it sounds just like a domain. The web host is what hosts the files so that people can connect to the website and actually view them. Basically, a domain redirects you to the IP, and hides the IP while viewing, for a neater look. It’ll change it from something like 77.66.21.123 to http://www.google.com, so it’s easier for people to remember/type.

Read full topic

item.title: Bought A Domain
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“CoderJessee, post:12, topic:475346”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=593447.msg4186714#msg4186714 date=1356257080]

Takes awhile for nameservers/A records to propagate.

if its a redirect no nameserver changes are made, clearly didn’t mask the domain correctly.
[/quote]
^

And your website is a leech though, I’ve seen it being released + I have it on my computer.[/quote]
hah tbh I don’t like the carbon fiber look

Read full topic

item.title: Bought A Domain
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:475346”][quote author=Mikeyzzz link=topic=593447.msg4186626#msg4186626 date=1356244263]

I just purchased a domain from GoDaddy, I don’t know what to do now, I already have I website programmed and ready for upload.

Well, you only bought a domain. You need a webhost, and to point the domain to the webhost’s servers.
[/quote]So in a way, I just threw away $10?

No. You can find a free webhost. And sign up. set it up so the domain is pointed to their servers. There, you have a working website with a domain.
It’s called domain parking.[/quote]So kind of redirecting the domain to another one.

Read full topic

item.title: Bought A Domain
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Mikeyzzz, post:3, topic:475346”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=593447.msg4186612#msg4186612 date=1356240989]

I just purchased a domain from GoDaddy, I don’t know what to do now, I already have I website programmed and ready for upload.

Well, you only bought a domain. You need a webhost, and to point the domain to the webhost’s servers.
[/quote]So in a way, I just threw away $10?[/quote]
No. You can find a free webhost. And sign up. set it up so the domain is pointed to their servers. There, you have a working website with a domain.
It’s called domain parking.

Read full topic
